title: Fans hail Eliud Kipchoge on social media after he shatters two-hour marathon barrier in Vienna
text:
High-profile figures, fans and football clubs took to social media to praise the incredible achievement of Eliud Kipchoge after he became the first runner to finish a marathon in under two hours.

Unbelievably, the 34-year-old Kenyan completed the Vienna course in a rapid one hour, 59 minutes and 40 seconds.

Twitter was quick to react with admiration and let the world know of their thoughts on the Kenyan's world-record feat.

Eliud Kipchoge crossed the line in under two hours and attracted instant worldwide attention

Kenyan fans were left amazed by their hero Kipchoge who was guided by coach Patrick Sang

Fan @matryansydney tweeted: 'What an achievement by Eliud Kpichoge for running a marathon under 2 hours. Unreal fitness, stamina and psychological strength. #Eliud159.'

Kenyan writer @OliverMathenge added: 'Four years ago, Paul Tergat whose marathon world record was 2:04:55 said that no man can run under two hours in this century. I guess he had not seen the resolve by @EliudKipchoge whose record is 2:01:39. #Eliud159.'

Tweeting from Nairobi, @kuria_ngari praised Kipchoge's coach Patrick Sang: 'The man behind the historic maker. Thank you me. Patrick sang #Eliud159.'

Fans were left inspired by Kipchoge's record run and expressed their thoughts on social media

Another Kenyan fan @kirwanyams commented: 'He came, He ran, He broke the record. Truly amazing, Congratulations #Eliud159.'

Political figure @bonifacemwangi joined in the congratulations, tweeting: 'We should line up the entire road from the airport to Nairobi CBD to welcome. Receive him like the HERO he is.'

Another supporter @KibetKigen_ added: Show love for Eliud Kipchoge. He is inspiring everyone in the World. Anything is possible #Eliud159.'

Kipchoge's achievement attracted cross-sporting recognition including from Manchester City

Even football clubs, from Nairobi to Manchester, couldn't help but join the Kipchoge party.

@AFCLeopards, second in the Kenyan Premier League, commented: '1:59:40!!! WELL DONE ELIUD 'GOAT' KIPCHOGE.'

Back in England, @ManCity - similarly second in the Premier League - posted: 'Congratulations to sporting history made! Absolutely incredible!'
description: High-profile figures, fans and even football clubs took to social media to hail the incredible achievement of Eliud Kipchoge who became the first runner to finish a marathon in under two hours.
